manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Creative Pebble Modern 2.0 USB Desktop Speakers Inspired by the zen Japanese rock garden, the orb-shaped Creative Pebble is a sleek and elegant 2.0 speaker system that looks perfect in any home and office. It features a 45° elevated sound stage for enhanced audio projection and is powered by a single USB cable for hassle-free music entertainment.
X MARKS THE SPOT Featuring a 45° elevated custom-tuned far-field driver solution, the Creative Pebble directs audio to your ears, placing you in the sweet spot for great audio enjoyment.

SMALL BUT MIGHTY With its built-in passive radiators and an impressive combined RMS of 4.4W, the small Creative Pebble is able to deliver balanced audio with depth, immersiveness and crystal clear details. Simply connect your device via the 3.5mm input and get ready to be blown away.

OTHER FEATURES CONVENIENCE WITHIN REACH Instantly control your volume with the Pebble’s convenient front panel control knob NO DESK SPACE? NO PROBLEM! Measuring at only 4.4 inches wide each, the Creative Pebble can be conveniently placed next to your PC monitor without compromising on valuable desk space. What’s more, the Pebble is conveniently powered by a single USB cable without the need for a wall outlet. MUSIC TO MATCH YOUR STYLE The Creative Pebble looks as good as it sounds. Choose from an exquisite black or pristine white to match your style and desk setup.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Value Budget Speakers, Hands Down
reviews.reviewText: (Written for the V1 Pebble)As the title suggests, you won't find better value for your money if you're on a budget. These are incredible quality for their price.Volume - You can drive these louder than you'd ever want to, no worries here.Sound Quality - I don't have much reference, but these sound great to me. I can't find anything to complain about.Build Quality - Better than you would expect for the price. Seems like they're made to last.Ease of Use - Plug and play as advertised unless you're looking to use these on Linux (tested on Ubuntu 22.04), but then again, when does Linux not require extra steps. The cable lengths are great, providing lots of flexibility.If you are looking for a cheap way to get audio out of your TV, desktop, laptop, etc. these are the way to go. I promise you won't be disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars USB-C power makes a big difference
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the version that is powered by USB-C but has a 3.5mm jack for the audio signal. I was pleasantly surprised, these speakers sound fantastic for the price. Very loud, and full range, great considering there is no sub. For music you aren’t going to get a lot of bump without a sub but it is still pretty darn good, the diaphragms on the back do a good job filling in some of the lows. For games the sound is clear and crisp, weapon fire sounds are super clean and have plenty of pop with no resonating or tinny echoes. I think this is probably as good as you can get under $50. I have a JBL Charge 3 bluetooth speaker that I think is comparable in volume but these Creatives are more crisp. Having the USB-C power source makes a huge difference in the capability of the speakers. You are effectively doubling the power output by using a higher wattage power source. Regular USB-A speakers are only around 4 watts where these are 8 watts, which is why these are so so good! Be careful though, not all computers have USB-C ports capable of outputting the required 8 watts, they need to be at least 3.2 v2x2 (dual channel) or Thunderbolt ports. If you have an older computer with v1 or single channel USB-C ports they only output 7.5 watts or less, in that case you may want to use a charging block to get the full performance of the speakers. Even if you need to buy a separate power supply, it is still worth it over the regular USB-A version. They also have a gain switch that can be turned down if you don’t have the higher wattage USB. Creative has a rich background in computer audio, you aren’t buying a generic brand here, they have a great reputation, surprising that they are so affordable!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Generally Good Speakers, Bad For Music
reviews.reviewText: These are cute, small speakers. They get pretty loud and generally sound clear. They're worth what you pay for them but there are a few downfalls.They're not labeled for sides, so they're easy to place wrong and have your audio jumbled up. The cable that connects the 2 speakers is long, but the cable that goes to the PC is not (and is only on the right speaker) which if you're like me and have your tower off to the far left, is not ideal. Also loud (or just generally heavy) music is a big no for these as they sound like theyre fading in and out and cannot handle any large amount of bass.But if you don't need any of that, then these are fine enough speakers for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's good for the price. They work very well.
reviews.reviewText: I'm very happy with these little speakers. I'm very happy with the quality of the speakers compared to other lower price speakers of this size. It's not a powerhouse sound system but they sound very good. Small speaker sold at this price point always sound tinny and crackle and break up. They plug into the computer using a USB C or A with an adapter. It also lets you plug an analog cable to back of the speaker to use with another device. The led light on front of the speaker is also button to switch between analog and USB sources.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Which is best?! Comparison of ALL Pebble speakers: V1 vs V2 vs V3
reviews.reviewText: Update: I also bought the v2.1 to test. This is the version with no passive radiator and has the high gain switch and a small bass module that sits under your desk. This model has significantly more head room in the bass section than the v1 and even the v3. These sounded best when utilizing a graphic EQ to push the frequencies below 60hz. The overall timbre of the speaker was very similar to the V1 (read my review below for that). This is hands down the best pebble speaker set. The bass module is not powered but it does provide more headroom and less distortion than “passive radiators” ever could. Best of all it doesn’t color the beautiful midrange and high end of the V1. I ended up keeping these. The V1 is still great for the money. But it’s night and day between the V1 and V2.1 - I think it’s worth the extra for the bass moduleI bought all three pebble speakers: V1, V2, V3. I could not find any good reviews of all three together so here is my attempt - Hope it helps! My back ground I love music, perform live regularly and own speakers from Definitive Tech, Mirage, Hsu Research, etc.V1 - Very transparent sounding top end. Airy, open, detailed are immediate words that come to mind. These speakers nail this sense of "air" on tracks like Eric Claptions Signe (Unplugged). It does so in a way that is honestly shocking for the $18 I paid. These qualities evoke the appropriate emotional reaction to certain music like Norah Jones as the piano notes "float" in the sound stage the way they should and the brushes on the snare have the right shimmer. try these tracks your self to see for your self. Now the con's against these speakers lean more on the bass side - they severely lack bass response. That being said they also dont pretend to have any - there is no over bloated mid range. In certain pop tracks I found that I preferred using Apple's "sound enhancer" to accentuate the bass response.V2 - These physically are the same size as the V1 but they have a modified power amp section for a claimed double in wattage at 16 watt peak. They also include a high gain/low gain switch on the bottom of the right speaker. They sound good in both high gain/low gain - the high gain mode has a clear bump in the mid range. You can hear how the high power amp pushes those mid frequencies. There is a noticable increase in mid bass clarity compared to V1. When pushed on tracks like Ingrid Michelson's The Way I Am - The added mid range bass is a clear advantage. I would not call this "Punchy" Bass however as these speakers are still the same as V1. But the biggest con agains the V2 is the trade off for this slight mid bass is a lack of clarity in the top end. The magic of the V1's air is lost to the attempt to push the passive radiators to create a sense of low end. Not to mention it costs more.V3 - These speakers were very disappointing to me. They have an even more pronounced muddy top end due to an over accentuated mid range bump. I can see how some could hear this as "more bass" but take my review for what it is - these will not satisfy in the bass section. The worst part is the trade off's due to physics of having such a small speaker. All of these design choices trade ALL of the top end clarity that existed in the V1. They definitely sound more "boxy" and in your face. None of the subtlety of the V1 exists. These speakers sound like tiny speakers trying to be something they are not. Furthermore they cost double what the V1 are currently priced at. They do have a Bluetooth feature if that matters to you.Note: I also did a blind test with my wife who has a good ear - She also noticed the special clarity of the V1. Also, I did use a high powered USB source for max potential for each of the speakers (I also found little difference between this and using the laptops USB port). For those reviews that talk about more volume - ALL three speakers sound like trash at max volume so I don't think that should be a deciding factor - all three produce acceptable volume.In conclusion, all three speakers do have very similar frequency responses. They share more similarities than differences. They ALL sound good for what they are: hence the positive reviews for all of them. But after comparing head to head: the V2 and V3 are a compromise in the wrong direction. They are trying to push the wattage of these tiny speakers which can't handle it in the first place. Do yourself a favor... buy the V1 for $18. If all three were the same price I would still choose the V1 for its clarity and detail. When I closed my eyes this speaker evoked an emotional response from me... when the other two only reminded me of its limitations.

Got this as a gift for my girlfriend and they're great speakers! Works well, sounds nice and for the price, we have no complaints. We like how minimalist and easy they are to use. They have bluetooth, direction connection via usb type c which is great for her as she has a macbook. no need for an adapter.

reviews.reviewTitle: Impressive Audio Upgrade for Your Desktop: Creative Pebble V3 Delivers Crystal Clear Sound!
reviews.reviewText: I recently upgraded my desktop audio setup with the Creative Pebble V3 Minimalistic 2.0 USB-C Desktop Speakers, and I must say, I'm thoroughly impressed. These speakers not only boast a sleek and modern design that complements any desktop environment, but they also deliver exceptional audio quality.The USB-C connectivity is a standout feature, providing a hassle-free and efficient connection to my desktop. Setting up the speakers was a breeze - just plug and play. The USB Audio capability ensures a clear and crisp audio signal, eliminating the need for additional power cables.One of the key highlights of the Creative Pebble V3 is its ability to produce clear dialogues. Whether I'm watching movies, attending virtual meetings, or playing games, the speakers deliver dialogues with impressive clarity. The sound is well-balanced, offering a rich audio experience without overpowering bass or harsh trebles.The minimalistic design of these speakers is another aspect that I appreciate. They take up minimal space on my desk while still making a stylish statement. The front-facing volume control knob is a convenient touch, allowing me to adjust the volume easily without having to reach for my computer.These speakers are also surprisingly powerful for their compact size. The 4.4-inch drivers deliver a punchy and dynamic sound that enhances my overall multimedia experience. The soundstage is wide, providing an immersive feel whether I'm watching movies or listening to music.In conclusion, the Creative Pebble V3 Minimalistic 2.0 USB-C Desktop Speakers exceeded my expectations. If you're in the market for desktop speakers that combine style with outstanding audio performance, these are a fantastic choice. Upgrade your desktop setup with the Creative Pebble V3, and you won't be disappointed!

reviews.reviewTitle: Audio Excellence Meets Sleek Design - Creative Pebble PRO
reviews.reviewText: The Creative Pebble PRO has exceeded all my expectations and solidified its place as my go-to audio companion. If you're looking for a compact and powerful speaker that delivers exceptional sound quality, look no further.First and foremost, the design is strikingly modern and minimalist. The sleek, spherical shape and matte black finish complement any workspace or living area. It's a stylish addition to any setup, whether you're using it with your computer, gaming console, or mobile device.The audio quality is where the Creative Pebble PRO truly shines. Despite its compact size, it packs a punch. The rich and balanced sound output is impressive, and it fills the room with clear, detailed audio. Whether I'm listening to music, watching movies, or gaming, the Pebble PRO never fails to deliver a fantastic audio experience.The built-in USB-C connectivity is a welcome feature. It not only ensures a stable connection but also simplifies the setup process, eliminating the need for additional cables or power adapters. It's a true plug-and-play experience.The volume control is conveniently located on the front of the speaker, allowing for quick and easy adjustments. The illuminated LED ring adds a touch of elegance and provides visual feedback on the current volume level.The Creative Pebble PRO is also surprisingly versatile. It works seamlessly with various devices, from laptops and desktops to gaming consoles and smartphones. It's an all-in-one audio solution that adapts to your needs.In conclusion, the Creative Pebble PRO is a stellar choice for anyone in search of high-quality audio in a compact and stylish package. Its outstanding sound performance, modern design, and user-friendly features make it a standout speaker in its class. Whether you're enhancing your work setup or upgrading your entertainment system, the Pebble PRO is a fantastic investment. Highly recommended!

Been looking around for a small desk speaker with good stylish, great sounding, and great price. Come across this Pebble 2.0, that almost hit all of it. The sound was so lively, forwarding that just wrap around you, not stay back in speaker is a surprising touch, just need a little more bass and it will be an amazing product.But even that, this is an unbeatable desktop speaker, I was way satisficed and would recommend it to anyone for this size of desktop speaker set. You won't disappointed.

Me gustó y me sorprendió la calidad del sonido sinceramente esperaba menos pero el sonido tiene muy buena calidad. Para trabajar en oficina y escuchar música y jugar está excelente el sistema de bocinas. Lo único que no me agrado mucho fue el color verde pero no hay mucho conflicto con eso. Por el precio recibe uno mucha calidad.
